text:
Hello,
I think I already reported this a long time ago for JMeter 2.3.2
I have upgraded to JMeter 2.7 and have the following probelm.

I invoke JMeter from ant with the following task:
<jmeter jmeterhome="${basedir}/../../jmeter/apache-jmeter-2.7"
                resultlog="${basedir}/jMeterTests/JMeterResults.xml"
                failureproperty="test.failed">
            <jvmarg value="-Duser.language=en"/>
            <testplans dir="${basedir}/jMeterTests" includes="Test-ECAS-Server.jmx"/>
            <property name="jmeter.save.saveservice.assertion_results" value="all"/>
            <property name="jmeter.save.saveservice.output_format" value="xml"/>
            <property name="ecas.version" value="${app.version}.${build.id}"/>
            <property name="ftp.user" value="${dev1.ftp.userid}"/>
            <property name="ftp.pwd" value="${dev1.ftp.password}"/>
        </jmeter>

As a result of the tests, the failureproperty returns true even though all tests are succelful (I checked the results). 
It fails on a request returning a 403. In my test, on that request, I have a Response Assertion doing a "Matches" on the "Response Code" and I checked the "Ignore Status" box.
Checking the test through the GUI it is successful but running it through Ant returns the "failureproperty" set to TRUE. It worked with JMeter 2.3.2 

Thank you very much,
Regards,
Baudouin Dupont
creator: baudouin.dupont@ext.ec.europa.eu

text:
JMeter ant task is not related to JMeter project.
Please report your issue to concerned project.
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
